resolution.description: The product is working as designed.
resolution.name: Not a Bug

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
I built a setup from source with a sequence that sets up UI. System link: http://10.111.1.120/euca-qa/display_test.php?testname=alice-ui-test-new&uid=1033

When I logged in, there was no UI running.

{code}
euca-prod-1-29:~ alicehubenko$ ssh root@10.111.5.21 
root@10.111.5.21's password: 
Last login: Wed Oct 30 14:46:12 2013 from euca-prod-1-29.eucalyptus-systems.com
[root@h-21 ~]# ps aux|grep console
root     18605  0.0  0.0 103244   848 pts/0    S+   12:11   0:00 grep console
root     31209  0.0  0.0  10452   256 ?        Ss   Oct30   0:00 eucalyptus-cloud --java-home=/usr/lib/jvm/java-1.7.0 -Debs.storage.manager=DASManager --db-home=/usr/pgsql-9.1/ -h /opt/eucalyptus -u eucalyptus --pidfile /opt/eucalyptus/var/run/eucalyptus/eucalyptus-cloud.pid -f -L console-log -o /opt/eucalyptus/var/log/eucalyptus/startup.log -e /opt/eucalyptus/var/log/eucalyptus/startup.log
500      31271 11.0  9.6 4732744 774664 ?      Sl   Oct30 145:42 eucalyptus-cloud --java-home=/usr/lib/jvm/java-1.7.0 -Debs.storage.manager=DASManager --db-home=/usr/pgsql-9.1/ -h /opt/eucalyptus -u eucalyptus --pidfile /opt/eucalyptus/var/run/eucalyptus/eucalyptus-cloud.pid -f -L console-log -o /opt/eucalyptus/var/log/eucalyptus/startup.log -e /opt/eucalyptus/var/log/eucalyptus/startup.log

{code}


Next, I switched branches:
{code}
[root@h-21 eucalyptus-console]# git checkout hotfix-01
Branch hotfix-01 set up to track remote branch hotfix-01 from origin.
Switched to a new branch 'hotfix-01'

{code}

After verifying console.ini looks good I tried to launch UI.
{code}
[root@h-21 eucalyptus-console]# ./launcher.sh 
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "euca-console-server", line 237, in <module>
    eucaconsole.config = ConfigLoader().getParser(config_file)
  File "/root/euca_builder/eucalyptus-console/eucaconsole/configloader.py", line 71, in getParser
    logging.config.fileConfig(config)
  File "/usr/lib64/python2.6/logging/config.py", line 84, in fileConfig
    handlers = _install_handlers(cp, formatters)
  File "/usr/lib64/python2.6/logging/config.py", line 162, in _install_handlers
    h = klass(*args)
  File "/usr/lib64/python2.6/logging/handlers.py", line 112, in __init__
    BaseRotatingHandler.__init__(self, filename, mode, encoding, delay)
  File "/usr/lib64/python2.6/logging/handlers.py", line 64, in __init__
    logging.FileHandler.__init__(self, filename, mode, encoding, delay)
  File "/usr/lib64/python2.6/logging/__init__.py", line 827, in __init__
    StreamHandler.__init__(self, self._open())
  File "/usr/lib64/python2.6/logging/__init__.py", line 846, in _open
    stream = open(self.baseFilename, self.mode)
IOError: [Errno 2] No such file or directory: '/var/log/eucalyptus/console.log'
{code}

I created a dir /var/log/eucalyptus and tried to launch console, I got this:

{code}
File "/root/euca_builder/eucalyptus-console/eucaconsole/__init__.py", line 293, in post
    response = InitProcessor.post(self)
  File "/root/euca_builder/eucalyptus-console/eucaconsole/__init__.py", line 472, in post
    url_rewrite = config.get('server', 'url.rewrite')
  File "/usr/lib64/python2.6/ConfigParser.py", line 541, in get
    raise NoOptionError(option, section)
NoOptionError: No option 'url.rewrite' in section: 'server'
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/root/euca_builder/eucalyptus-console/eucaconsole/__init__.py", line 296, in post
    raise EuiException(401, 'not authorized')
EuiException
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/root/euca_builder/eucalyptus-console/eucaconsole/__init__.py", line 293, in post
    response = InitProcessor.post(self)
  File "/root/euca_builder/eucalyptus-console/eucaconsole/__init__.py", line 472, in post
    url_rewrite = config.get('server', 'url.rewrite')
  File "/usr/lib64/python2.6/ConfigParser.py", line 541, in get
    raise NoOptionError(option, section)
NoOptionError: No option 'url.rewrite' in section: 'server'
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/root/euca_builder/eucalyptus-console/eucaconsole/__init__.py", line 296, in post
    raise EuiException(401, 'not authorized')
EuiException
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/root/euca_builder/eucalyptus-console/eucaconsole/__init__.py", line 293, in post
    response = InitProcessor.post(self)
  File "/root/euca_builder/eucalyptus-console/eucaconsole/__init__.py", line 472, in post
    url_rewrite = config.get('server', 'url.rewrite')
  File "/usr/lib64/python2.6/ConfigParser.py", line 541, in get
    raise NoOptionError(option, section)
NoOptionError: No option 'url.rewrite' in section: 'server'
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/root/euca_builder/eucalyptus-console/eucaconsole/__init__.py", line 296, in post
    raise EuiException(401, 'not authorized')
EuiException
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/root/euca_builder/eucalyptus-console/eucaconsole/__init__.py", line 293, in post
    response = InitProcessor.post(self)
  File "/root/euca_builder/eucalyptus-console/eucaconsole/__init__.py", line 472, in post
    url_rewrite = config.get('server', 'url.rewrite')
  File "/usr/lib64/python2.6/ConfigParser.py", line 541, in get

NoOptionError: No option 'url.rewrite' in section: 'server'
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/root/euca_builder/eucalyptus-console/eucaconsole/__init__.py", line 296, in post
    raise EuiException(401, 'not authorized')
EuiException

{code}
fields.summary: Could not start console after changing branch

comments.body: after the "git checkout hotfix-01", did you do "git pull origin hotfix-01" ? DId you copy the console.ini.default and modify it?

Hi [~dkavanagh].

The fix branch I used  is up to date: 
{code}
[root@h-21 eucalyptus-console]# git pull origin hotfix-01
From https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucalyptus-console
 * branch            hotfix-01  -> FETCH_HEAD
Already up-to-date.
{code}

console.ini seems to be correct, I included it so you can verify.  Yes, I changed [logger_root] like you told us in your earlier email.

{code}
[server]
# set this value to the address or dns name of your cloud front end
clchost=10.111.5.21
# this is used in the about dialog to direct people to the admin console
clcwebport=8443

# This defines the port at which the server will run
uiport=8888

# This is for the ssl cert. 
# this site has a procedure for generating self sign ssl certs;
#   http://www.akadia.com/services/ssh_test_certificate.html
# set the paths for the cert and key as follows, then you will be using "https://host:port/" in your browser
sslcert=/etc/eucalyptus/console-certs/ssl.crt
sslkey=/etc/eucalyptus/console-certs/ssl.key

# Set to true to enable a redirect server for http
http.redirect=False
# Set to port 80 if run as root, or higher number port
# (requires http.redirect set to True)
http.port=8080

# session timeout (in seconds, 30 minutes -> 1800 seconds)
session.idle.timeout=1800
session.abs.timeout=43200
# 43200 sec = 12 hours

# browser ajax timeout. defaults to 30 seconds which can be lengthened for slow back end servers
ajax.timeout=30000

# set this value to control the rate of updates from the CLC. The
# units are in seconds.
pollfreq=15
# override default frequency setting for specific resources:
# (images, instance, keypairs, groups, addresses, volumes, snapshots)
pollfreq.images=120
pollfreq.zones=500
pollfreq.amazonimages=1200
pollfreq.allimages=1200

# When set to True, allows proxy to only refresh caches for data the user needs
# in the current view.
# When set to False, the proxy will refresh caches for all resources which does
# give new data to the user faster when they are moving between pages in the app.
min.clc.polling=True

# maximum number of request threads the proxy will allow at once. These threads
# aren't based on cores, they are how many outstanding requests to the CLC we'd
# like to allow at once.
threads.max=50

[aws]
# set to true to allow aws login with the console.
enable.aws=True

# set this to define a default region for aws login
default.region=us-west-1

[locale]
# Available languages.
# UI messages and help files: en_US, zh_CN
# UI messages only: ko_KR, ru_RU, ja_JP, fi_FI
language=en_US

# help page
help.url=https://engage.eucalyptus.com?r=euca-
# admin support url
support.url=http://your-cloud-admin-portal/
#support.url=mailto: support@yourdomain.com

[test]
# Set this value to True if you wish to use mock data instead of talking to the CLC.
usemock=False

# This value is used to incur delays in the proxy resonse to API calls.
# It can mimic a slow network for the browser
#apidelay=200

##
# These sections are used to configure the logger. For info, see docs for the python logging package
##

[loggers]
keys=root

[handlers]
keys=eucahandler,eucahandler_dev

[formatters]
keys=eucaformat

[logger_root]
level=DEBUG
handlers=eucahandler_dev

[handler_eucahandler_dev]
class=StreamHandler
level=NOTSET
formatter=eucaformat
args=(sys.stdout,)

[handler_eucahandler]
class=handlers.RotatingFileHandler
level=NOTSET
formatter=eucaformat
args=('/var/log/eucalyptus/console.log', 'a', 1000000, 10)

[formatter_eucaformat]
format=%(asctime)-15s %(levelname)s %(message)s
datefmt=%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S

##
# End logger config
##
{code}

Hi David,  

We just looked at the issue with [~viglesias]. After the option url.rewrite was added into console.ini, the UI started working. Can you tell us why the url.rewrite option was not in the console.ini by default?

Thank you,
Alice

The url.rewrite option was removed from the console.ini.default as part of https://eucalyptus.atlassian.net/browse/EUCA-7492

I find nothing in the console code that references that anymore and I only found 1 reference when I did that work. I suspect you have old code looking at a newer config file. Did you install from packages but grab the config file from source? If you had eucalyptus-console installed at one point and did not remove the package, even if you have the source installed and run from ./launcher.sh, you will run the package code since that is installed in the python lib tree. You must make sure there are no other copies of the console code installed. Try running "find /usr -name publicdata.py" to see if it returns anything.

Hi David, I grabbed the config from source and I had the test install maint/3.4/testing. The test copied the console.ini (with removed options there), then I switched branches and still used the same console.ini (which now needed the options). I understand now what happened. Closing issue.
